required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Blood Collection From Heart Failure Patients to Evaluate for Galectin-3 Measurement Differences Using Various Collection Tubes

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

detailed_description.textblock: 45 Heart Failure patients will be recruited. Patients will provide a one-time blood sample specimen collection. Theses samples will be de-identified and provided for measurement of Galectin-3 on commercial platforms.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Obtain 45 matched donor serum and plasma samples sets collected from Heart Failure patients for galectin-3 measurements

clinical_study.condition: To Measure Galectin-3 in Heart Failure Patients on Commercial Platforms

arm_group.description: No interventions for this study. Blood draw provided by patients.

study_pop.textblock: 45 matched door serum and plasma. Samples set collected form individual Heart Failure patients for galecin-3 measurements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Heart Failure patients New York Heart Association class able to provide (4) collection tube types Subjects > 18 years old All subjects must provide informed consent and associated documentation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects that cannot tolerate blood withdrawal of 4 specimens collection tube tubes (approximately 40 mLs)

overall_official.affiliation: Universtiy of Maryland School of Medicine

facility.name: University of Maryland School of Medicine
